# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    # Initialize result string and word count
    result = ""
    wc = 0

    # Iterate over words in str
    for word in split(str)
        # Check if adding the current word would exceed text_width
        if wc + length(word) > text_width
            # If so, add a newline and reset word count
            result *= "\n"
            wc = 0
        end

        # Add the current word to the result string
        result *= word
        wc += length(word) + 1
    end

    return result
end
```
### Example
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello, world!", 5)
"Hello,
world!"

julia> wrap_string("This is a very long sentence that needs to be wrapped.", 10)
"This is a
very long
sentence
that needs
to be
wrapped."
```
